SEARCH
Package uk.msci.project.rsa

Class SigScheme

java.lang.Object
uk.msci.project.rsa.SigScheme
All Implemented Interfaces:
SigSchemeInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
ANSI_X9_31_RDSA, ISO_IEC_9796_2_SCHEME_1, RSASSA_PKCS1_v1_5
public abstract class SigScheme extends Object implements SigSchemeInterface
This abstract class provides a specialised framework for implementing a signature scheme using the RSA algorithm. It implements the SigSchemeInterface and provides concrete and standardised implementations of some of its methods, along with additional functionality specific to RSA-based signature schemes.

Key components are encapsulated within the class, allowing for a modular and extensible design suitable for various RSA-based signature schemes.

  • Constructor Details

    • SigScheme

      public SigScheme(Key key)
      Constructs a Signature scheme instance with the specified RSA key. Initialises the modulus and exponent from the key, calculates the encoded message length, and sets up the SHA-256 message digest along with a predefined hash ID.
      Parameters:
      key - The RSA key containing the exponent and modulus.

      Returns:

      Throws:

    • sign

      public byte[] sign(byte[] M) throws DataFormatException

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Throws:

    • verify

      public boolean verify(byte[] M, byte[] S) throws DataFormatException
      Verifies an RSA signature against a given message. Returns true if the signature is valid.
      Specified by:
      verify in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      M - The original message.
      S - The RSA signature to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the signature is valid, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - If verification fails due to incorrect format.

    • I2OSP

      public byte[] I2OSP(BigInteger m) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Converts a BigInteger to an octet string of length emLen where emLen is the ceiling of ((emBits - 1)/8) and emBits is the bit length of the RSA modulus.
      Specified by:
      I2OSP in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      m - The BigInteger to be converted into an octet string.
      Returns:
      A byte array representing the BigInteger in its octet string form, of length emLen.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the BigInteger's byte array representation is not of the expected length or has an unexpected leading byte.

    • RSASP1

      public BigInteger RSASP1(BigInteger m)
      Calculates the RSA signature of a given message representative by raising it to the power of the private exponent as outlined by the RSA algorithm.
      Specified by:
      RSASP1 in interface SigSchemeInterface
      Parameters:
      m - The message representative, an integer representation of the message.
      Returns:
